alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 4:26PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Kobuk River at the Village of Kobuk. * WHEN...Until 215 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying roads is occurring in the Village of Kobuk. Water will likely rise over the next day or two and and flooding will get worse. Moderate flooding is expected and it is possible that homes in low lying areas could flood. Large blocks of ice could push onshore near the river bank. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM AKDT Saturday, Residents reported an ice jam formed on the Kobuk River near Kobuk Village that is causing minor flooding of low lying roads. Although water level has dropped since Friday, there ice upstream of town that could break loose and jam up near town over the next several days. If this ice upstream breaks loose and jams near town, it could cause water levels to rise rapidly. With additional snowmelt this weekend water levels will continue to rise behind this ice jam. Flooding will continue to get worse over the weekend until the ice jam breaks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along Kobuk River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
